explanation: The program compared the raw input lines (which are given with spaces, e.g. "R G B") against A = ["RGB","GBR","BRG"], so membership always failed. I fixed the single incorrect line by making A contain the spaced forms that match the input format (e.g. "R G B"). This keeps the rest of the code unchanged and makes the membership checks work for both S and T.
fixed_code:
A = ["R G B","G B R","B R G"]

S = input()
T = input()
print('Yes' if (S in A) == (T in A) else 'No')
